title: The May 2025 EVE Online Monthly Economic Report
description: Oh, hey, we got the Monthly Economic Report for May 2025, but there were enough other things going on that I barely had any time to look at it until the weekend was almost over. As always, others write and comment about the MER, so if you are interested there are sources worth seeking. CCP […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: Oh, hey, we got the Monthly Economic Report for May 2025, but there were enough other things going on that I barely had any time to look at it until the weekend was almost over. As always, others w…
text: Oh, hey, we got the Monthly Economic Report for May 2025, but there were enough other things going on that I barely had any time to look at it until the weekend was almost over. EVE Online nerds harder As always, others write and comment about the MER, so if you are interested there are sources worth seeking. CCP – May 2025 Monthly Economic Report CCP – May 2025 MER Forum Thread Reddit – May 2025 MER Thread TNG – A Look At The May 2025 Active ISK Delta CCP Highlights CCP’s take away from the May MER: 9% Increase in Production April vs May 2025. Mining and Destruction are stable. MPI continues to fall, but at a much slower rate than April 2025. It’s likely we are going to remove the Import, Export, and Trade Balance plots from the MER, due to the data-source being deprecated. We are working with the EVE Development Team to get a new data source that will give us more verbose data, enabling us to better calculate Imports, Exports and Trade balance. There isn’t much there to dig into.  But May was also an odd month, with not much going on at the front end save for Capsuleer Day, and then the Legion expansion and a new war popping off at the end of the month. The effects of both of those are unlikely to be visible until the June MER comes out. Meanwhile, the mineral price index, the MPI, did in fact continue to fall a bit, dropping down to about the level it was at its peak in 2021, the all time high caused by CCP’s intervention in the economy that, I will remind everybody, led to an all time sustained low for player logins. May 2025 – Economic Indices CCP spent a year trying to convince itself that its crackpot view of economics and player behavior would prove to be true before finally starting to fix things.  We’re still in the fixing phase. I expect that the MPI might go up some when we get the June MER data, not so much because of the invasion of Insmother… that was a bit of a damp squib for destruction, PanFam opting to let the region go with only token resistance… but due to the disruption that will come from the Imperium once again moving eastward.  Certainly if there was an ice products price index it would be going up as all those capitals and jump freighters are burning it up hauling stuff across space. Destruction Summary Again, a war started at the end of the month, so probably not much impact on the May numbers.  Looking at the destruction by day, the month actually seemed to start off stronger than it ended. May 2025 – Losses Per Day I suppose we at least have a baseline to see if the war had any influence on the overall destruction numbers… though the collapse of any PanFam resistance in Insmother means it probably won’t be that significant.  Still, here are the destruction numbers so far for 2025: Loss Count Total January – 514,511 total losses February – 427,027 total losses March – 538,625 total losses April – 464,177 total losses May – 530,632 total losses Avg Losses per Day January – 16,597.13 losses per day February – 15,250.96 losses per day March – 17,375.00 losses per day April – 15,472.57 losses per day May – 17,117.16 losses per day Total ISK Value Lost January – 46.86 trillion ISK February – 44.55 trillion ISK March – 50.78 trillion ISK April – 47.77 trillion ISK May – 52.10 trillion ISK Total ISK Value Lost per Day January – 1,511.77 billion ISK per day February – 1,590.99 billion ISK per day March – 1,638.07 billion ISK per day April – 1592.22 billion ISK per day May – 1680.63 billion ISK per day Still, the numbers for May reflect more people being online. Meanwhile, speaking of baselines, I might as well set one here to compare against next month. Region Sum of ISK Lost % of May Region  Count  % of May The Forge 2.72 trillion 5.22% K-R00033        49,014 9.24% Pochven 2.64 trillion 5.07% Delve        31,143 5.87% Delve 2.20 trillion 4.22% Metropolis        26,369 4.97% Vale of the Silent 1.97 trillion 3.78% Heimatar        23,786 4.48% The Citadel 1.84 trillion 3.53% Placid        18,970 3.57% Heimatar 1.68 trillion 3.22% Vale of the Silent        18,916 3.56% Metropolis 1.67 trillion 3.20% The Forge        18,355 3.46% Lonetrek 1.59 trillion 3.06% The Citadel        17,152 3.23% Sinq Laison 1.45 trillion 2.78% Genesis        14,758 2.78% Fountain 1.28 trillion 2.46% Pochven        14,673 2.77% Of the systems that have seen action related to the war, only Delve is in the top ten, and only because PanFam had been trying to farm Brave for content even before the war started. For Scalding Pass and Insmother, where the Imperium invaded and took space, May saw those regions in 24th and 32nd place for ISK and 25th and 31st place for count of hulls destroyed.  Will the war see them rise up the ranks? The strange item on the list is the region K-R00033, which was 67th place for ISK loss, but in first place for hull count.  I think this was part of the Drifter event that CCP had running in high sec, but I was curious about what sort of ships were lost to get that mismatch in ISK vs count.  Do we have another Uitra situation brewing?  But the top five hull types lost were as follows. Hull  Count  Corvette        32,085 Capsule        11,168 Shuttle           4,272 Frigate              311 Cruiser              258 Of the 49K lost in the system, more than 43K of them were corvettes or capsules.  Clearly there was some way to work the system.  I didn’t participate in the event, so I am not sure what was up.  But it is over now and likely won’t affect the June numbers. What will likely show up is the 3 trillion ISK battle in Lantorn that went off yesterday.  Null sec is off fighting in low sec again.
html:
Oh, hey, we got the Monthly Economic Report for May 2025, but there were enough other things going on that I barely had any time to look at it until the weekend was almost over.

EVE Online nerds harder

As always, others write and comment about the MER, so if you are interested there are sources worth seeking.

  • CCP – May 2025 Monthly Economic Report
  • CCP – May 2025 MER Forum Thread
  • Reddit – May 2025 MER Thread
  • TNG – A Look At The May 2025 Active ISK Delta

CCP Highlights

CCP’s take away from the May MER:

  • 9% Increase in Production April vs May 2025. Mining and Destruction are stable.
  • MPI continues to fall, but at a much slower rate than April 2025.
  • It’s likely we are going to remove the Import, Export, and Trade Balance plots from the MER, due to the data-source being deprecated. We are working with the EVE Development Team to get a new data source that will give us more verbose data, enabling us to better calculate Imports, Exports and Trade balance.

There isn’t much there to dig into.  But May was also an odd month, with not much going on at the front end save for Capsuleer Day, and then the Legion expansion and a new war popping off at the end of the month.

The effects of both of those are unlikely to be visible until the June MER comes out.

Meanwhile, the mineral price index, the MPI, did in fact continue to fall a bit, dropping down to about the level it was at its peak in 2021, the all time high caused by CCP’s intervention in the economy that, I will remind everybody, led to an all time sustained low for player logins.

May 2025 – Economic Indices

CCP spent a year trying to convince itself that its crackpot view of economics and player behavior would prove to be true before finally starting to fix things.  We’re still in the fixing phase.

I expect that the MPI might go up some when we get the June MER data, not so much because of the invasion of Insmother… that was a bit of a damp squib for destruction, PanFam opting to let the region go with only token resistance… but due to the disruption that will come from the Imperium once again moving eastward.  Certainly if there was an ice products price index it would be going up as all those capitals and jump freighters are burning it up hauling stuff across space.

Destruction Summary

Again, a war started at the end of the month, so probably not much impact on the May numbers.  Looking at the destruction by day, the month actually seemed to start off stronger than it ended.

May 2025 – Losses Per Day

I suppose we at least have a baseline to see if the war had any influence on the overall destruction numbers… though the collapse of any PanFam resistance in Insmother means it probably won’t be that significant.  Still, here are the destruction numbers so far for 2025:

  • Loss Count Total
    • January – 514,511 total losses
    • February – 427,027 total losses
    • March – 538,625 total losses
    • April – 464,177 total losses
    • May – 530,632 total losses
  • Avg Losses per Day
    • January – 16,597.13 losses per day
    • February – 15,250.96 losses per day
    • March – 17,375.00 losses per day
    • April – 15,472.57 losses per day
    • May – 17,117.16 losses per day
  • Total ISK Value Lost
    • January – 46.86 trillion ISK
    • February – 44.55 trillion ISK
    • March – 50.78 trillion ISK
    • April – 47.77 trillion ISK
    • May – 52.10 trillion ISK
  • Total ISK Value Lost per Day
    • January – 1,511.77 billion ISK per day
    • February – 1,590.99 billion ISK per day
    • March – 1,638.07 billion ISK per day
    • April – 1592.22 billion ISK per day
    • May – 1680.63 billion ISK per day

Still, the numbers for May reflect more people being online.

Meanwhile, speaking of baselines, I might as well set one here to compare against next month.

Region Sum of ISK Lost % of May Region  Count  % of May
The Forge 2.72 trillion 5.22% K-R00033        49,014 9.24%
Pochven 2.64 trillion 5.07% Delve        31,143 5.87%
Delve 2.20 trillion 4.22% Metropolis        26,369 4.97%
Vale of the Silent 1.97 trillion 3.78% Heimatar        23,786 4.48%
The Citadel 1.84 trillion 3.53% Placid        18,970 3.57%
Heimatar 1.68 trillion 3.22% Vale of the Silent        18,916 3.56%
Metropolis 1.67 trillion 3.20% The Forge        18,355 3.46%
Lonetrek 1.59 trillion 3.06% The Citadel        17,152 3.23%
Sinq Laison 1.45 trillion 2.78% Genesis        14,758 2.78%
Fountain 1.28 trillion 2.46% Pochven        14,673 2.77%

Of the systems that have seen action related to the war, only Delve is in the top ten, and only because PanFam had been trying to farm Brave for content even before the war started.

For Scalding Pass and Insmother, where the Imperium invaded and took space, May saw those regions in 24th and 32nd place for ISK and 25th and 31st place for count of hulls destroyed.  Will the war see them rise up the ranks?

The strange item on the list is the region K-R00033, which was 67th place for ISK loss, but in first place for hull count.  I think this was part of the Drifter event that CCP had running in high sec, but I was curious about what sort of ships were lost to get that mismatch in ISK vs count.  Do we have another Uitra situation brewing?  But the top five hull types lost were as follows.

Hull  Count 
Corvette        32,085
Capsule        11,168
Shuttle           4,272
Frigate              311
Cruiser              258

Of the 49K lost in the system, more than 43K of them were corvettes or capsules.  Clearly there was some way to work the system.  I didn’t participate in the event, so I am not sure what was up.  But it is over now and likely won’t affect the June numbers.

What will likely show up is the 3 trillion ISK battle in Lantorn that went off yesterday.  Null sec is off fighting in low sec again.
